meanings.definition: The external form or appearance of someone or something.
meanings.sent1: The circle is a simple shape.
meanings.sent2: She admired the unique shape of the clouds.
meanings.sent3: The balloon animal twisted into an unusual shape.
meanings.sent4: Her smile took the shape of a crescent moon.
meanings.sent5: The puzzle piece fit perfectly into its designated shape.

meanings.definition: A particular physical condition or form.
meanings.sent1: Exercise can help improve your body shape.
meanings.sent2: The vase shattered into many pieces, losing its original shape.
meanings.sent3: The cake took on a lopsided shape after it fell.
meanings.sent4: His thoughts began to take shape as he wrote them down.
meanings.sent5: The shadow cast by the tree had a distorted shape in the sunlight.

meanings.definition: To give a particular form or shape to.
meanings.sent1: She tried to shape the clay into a heart.
meanings.sent2: The sculptor used a chisel to shape the marble.
meanings.sent3: His words helped shape her decision to travel.
meanings.sent4: The architect worked tirelessly to shape the design of the building.
meanings.sent5: The chef used a cookie cutter to shape the dough into stars.
